title: [Large-Scale] Strategy for Improving Mathematical Problem-Solving Skills Through Teacher Collaboration: Comparative Analysis-Based PBL (Problem-Based Learning) Project

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary mathematical concepts (algebra, geometry, statistics, probability) and job-related competencies (data analysis, problem-solving, graph interpretation, formula application).
context.additional_context: Analyzing teacher collaboration cases in digital environments, establishing math learning improvement strategies, and applying them to actual PBL projects. Focus is on strengthening core competencies: graph interpretation, probabilistic thinking, mathematical modeling, and proof processes.

learning_goals: Through teacher collaboration system analysis, derive ≥3 student-centered mathematics learning strategies (e.g., equation utilization, graph interpretation, statistical analysis, proof process reinforcement)

Learners analyze three Hong Kong-Singapore international comparative cases, design two collaboration competency enhancement plans applicable to PBL projects (mathematical modeling, probabilistic thinking, formula application, calculation error pattern analysis), submit team execution plans, and meet ≥4 of 5 peer evaluation rubric criteria

Within six months, learners develop learner-level (beginner/intermediate/advanced) customized feedback algorithms (calculation error pattern analysis, graph interpretation support, proof process reinforcement) by analyzing formative assessment data (300+ learners), verifying 20% improvement in feedback satisfaction (3.5→4.2 on 5-point scale) via A/B testing compared to existing systems
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
